Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, slightly ribbed, fabric grey in section, interior spotted with traces of a black resinous substance, with remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior.
Curator's comments: The potsherd is broken, but probably nothing is lost.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.183)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36427) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36427)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 285 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
